channel.title: Japan 2023 on Vivere Ink
channel.description: Recent content in Japan 2023 on Vivere Ink

item.title: Day 11: Ashikaga Flower Park and Ikebukuro
item.description: Ashikaga Flower Park # So we’d finally arrived.

item.title: Day 10: DisneySea
item.description: DisneySea # On the one-mile walk to DisneySea from our hotel, we saw absolutely no other tourists on our way there as we passed a park and baseball field, which begged the question: Did everyone else use a shuttle to get there?

item.title: Day 9: Kawagoe
item.description: Returning to Tokyo # Today’s goal was mainly returning to Tokyo so we could go to DisneySea the next day.

item.title: Day 8: Universal Studios Japan
item.description: Isn’t amazing when transportation planners expect a tourist attraction will get so much traffic that it warrants its own train stop?

item.title: Day 7: The Kibi Plain, and Kurashiki
item.description: Kibi Plain # This day was reserved for renting bikes and riding the trail between Bizen Ichinomiya and Soja Stations, located in the rural flatlands of Kibi Plain just outside Okayama.

item.title: Day 6: Okayama
item.description: Exploring the neighborhood # Another specific request Van had for this trip was riding the Hello Kitty shinkansen, which runs between Osaka and Fukuoka.

item.title: Day 4: Nippori (Tokyo) and Nagai Park (Osaka)
item.description: Nippori Fabric Town # Because the only thing I’d planned for today was an outdoor art exhibition in Osaka that opened at 7 p.

item.title: Day 4: Hitachi Seaside Park, the Kodokan
item.description: Hitachi Seaside Park # Although we’d largely missed cherry blossom season in Tokyo, there were still plenty of other flowers in season.

item.title: Day 3: Nikko
item.description: Our destination for the day was Nikko, a Unesco World Heritage Site and national park nearly two hours away by train from Tokyo.

item.title: Day 2: Enoshima, Yokohama Ramen Museum
item.description: Enoshima # The next morning Van and I hopped on a JR train to Fujisawa Station, where we transferred to the Enoshima Electric Railway.

item.title: Day 1: Tokyo
item.description: Van and I left Portland, Oregon, the afternoon of Saturday, April 8, 2023.
